nodes.bodyText: we shouldn't lose coverage in this package. please review jacoco output and additional unit tests.
After thinking about this a little bit more, we should make the value as CompoundName. This would give us to have a little bit more flexibility to have .'s in our names - e.g. prod.us-west-2, etc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,7 @@ type RoleMeta Struct {
     String userAuthorityFilter (optional); //membership filtered based on user authority configured attributes
     String userAuthorityExpiration (optional); //expiration enforced by a user authority configured attribute
     Int32 groupExpiryDays (optional); //all groups in the domain roles will have specified max expiry days
+    Map<SimpleName,SimpleName> tags (optional); //key-value pair tags

nodes.bodyText: since the table itself is already called role_tags, I don't think we need to specify tag_key/tag_value as column names, just having key/value is sufficient.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS `zms_server`.`role_tags` (
+  `role_id` INT UNSIGNED NOT NULL,
+  `tag_key` VARCHAR(64) NOT NULL,

nodes.bodyText: If this is a map, how are we going to support multiple tags with the same key? I thought we made the index key as role_id+key+value so we can have multiple tags with the same key name -e.g. env=prod,env=stage, etc.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -48,6 +48,7 @@ type RoleMeta Struct {
     String userAuthorityFilter (optional); //membership filtered based on user authority configured attributes
     String userAuthorityExpiration (optional); //expiration enforced by a user authority configured attribute
     Int32 groupExpiryDays (optional); //all groups in the domain roles will have specified max expiry days
+    Map<SimpleName,SimpleName> tags (optional); //key-value pair tags

nodes.bodyText: empty strings is the correct value. the client code will skip and treat them as nils

commit.message: role tags - generated code and schema changes

beforeCommit.message: role tags - generated code and schema changes

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -831,13 +831,15 @@ public RoleList getRoleList(String domainName, Integer limit, String skip) {
      *
      * @param domainName name of the domain
      * @param members    include all members for group roles as well
+     * @param tagKey     query all roles with given tag name
+     * @param tagValue  query all roles with given tag key and value
      * @return list of roles
      * @throws ZMSClientException in case of failure
      */
-    public Roles getRoles(String domainName, Boolean members) {
+    public Roles getRoles(String domainName, Boolean members, String tagKey, String tagValue) {

nodes.bodyText: Yes, we should. I also have one outstanding issue in this method where the update role members should also return the result correctly to the processRole method.
In this method when we ask for roles without any members, we generate a new list of roles. In that section we need to update to return the tags as well.

This could be a very expensive operation. If a domain has 100 roles (which is not that uncommon), we're going to make 100 sql commands - with just regular latency this will add up quick considerably.
Any reason why we're not just running a query to get all tags for a domain and then parse the results and update accordingly. The roles are already in a map so we can quickly update each role accordingly.

Why do we have this in the interface? This is only an internal method and should not be in the interface.
One other general comment - we never expose the domainId outside of the implementation since that's jdbc specific only thing and the server only deals with names.

No need to call roleTag.get(tagKey) since the previous computeIfAbsent should already return the same value. So we can just say:
StringList tagValues = roleTag.computeIfAbsent(tagKey, k -> new StringList().setList(new ArrayList<>()));
same as above: No need to call roleTag.get(tagKey) since the previous computeIfAbsent should already return the same value.
